Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of immigration inadmissibility decision
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged membership in MQM and complicity in crimes against humanity
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Crimes Against Humanity and War Crimes Act
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Personal and knowing participation in persecutorial acts
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Unreasonable finding due to lack of personal involvement or intent
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration Division of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Alleged association with MQM and knowledge of atrocities
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Personal and knowing participation for complicity
Crimes.Credibility: Assessed but not found determinative for complicity
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident or foreign national in Canada

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of immigration inadmissibility decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether applicantâ€™s membership in MQM/APMSO constitutes inadmissibility under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board relied on documents and testimonies showing seven-year association
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On the Crown to establish membership by balance of probabilities
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Supporting documentation and testimonial evidence deemed credible
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Broad interpretation of 'membership' in a terrorist organization
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Applicant found to be a member of a terrorist organization
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged both membership and complicity findings
Crimes.Court_Result: Judicial review partially dismissed; complicity quashed, membership upheld
Crimes.Outcome: Deportation order maintained based on membership
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Stay of removal or cancellation of inadmissibility
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Partial success: complicity overturned, membership affirmed
